sentences.english: Strictly prohibit landlords and rich peasants from sneaking into the peasant associations and poor peasant leagues.
sentences.chinese: 严禁地主富农分子混入农民协会和贫农团。

sentences.english: One category has comparatively adequate farm implements and some funds.
sentences.chinese: 一部分贫农有比较充足的农具和相当数量的资金。

sentences.english: Organize poor peasant leagues first and then, after a few months, peasant associations.
sentences.chinese: 先组织贫农团，几个月后，再组织农民协会。

sentences.english: The semi-owner peasants are therefore more revolutionary than the owner-peasants, but less revolutionary than the poor peasants.
sentences.chinese: 故半自耕农的革命性优于自耕农而不及贫农。

sentences.english: The poor peasants, being the most revolutionary group, have gained the leadership of the peasant associations.
sentences.chinese: 贫农，因为最革命，所以他们取得了农会的领导权。

sentences.english: Jean Valjean came from a poor peasant family of Brie.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿让生在布里的一个贫农家里。

sentences.english: The term " peasantry" refers mainly to the poor and middle peasants.
sentences.chinese: 农民这个名称所包括的内容，主要地是指贫农和中农。

sentences.english: She was left an orphan and a poor peasant woman adopted her.
sentences.chinese: 她成了孤儿，一位贫农妇女收养了她。

sentences.english: In many cases the immediate demands of the poor peasantry were satisfied .
sentences.chinese: 多数情况是贫农的当前要求得到了满足。

sentences.english: He came of a poor peasant family.
sentences.chinese: 他出生在一个贫农家庭。

sentences.english: Villages have always worked hard to fight the main force is the poor peasant.
sentences.chinese: 乡村中一向苦战奋斗的主要力量是贫农。

sentences.english: Poor peasants especially to eat not the loss of culture, special needs education.
sentences.chinese: 贫农特别吃没有文化的亏，特别需要受教育。

sentences.english: Leadership by the poor peasants is absolutely necessary.
sentences.chinese: 这个贫农领导，是非常之需要的。

definition: rich peasant/social class of people farming their own land, intermediate between land-owner class 地主[di4 zhu3] and poor peasant 貧農|贫农[pin2 nong2]

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
social composition/social status (in Marxist theory, esp. using during the Cultural Revolution)
land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
